raw_text:
Redknapp's Saints face Pompey tie
 
 New Southampton manager Harry Redknapp faces an immediate reunion with his old club Portsmouth after they were drawn together in the FA Cup fourth round.
 
 Exeter City face a home tie against Middlesbrough if they can see off holders Manchester United in a replay. Oldham's reward for beating Manchester City is a home tie with Bolton, while Yeovil will be away to Charlton. Chelsea host Birmingham, Tottenham travel to West Brom and Arsenal will entertain Championship side Wolves. Saints boss Redknapp was upbeat about the draw despite having to face the club he walked out on just six weeks ago. "I've said before, I can walk away from Portsmouth with my head held high, I'm proud of what I did there and no one can take that away from me," said Redknapp. "Maybe I'll be in for some stick, there's always some of that but we'll get on with it and it's only a game of football." Birmingham manager Steve Bruce admitted their trip to Stamford Bridge to face Premiership leaders Chelsea was the toughest draw possible. Bruce said: "I'm still in shock. We've given good accounts of ourselves against Chelsea in the past and played well when we lost 1-0 at home at the start of the season - but that's the past. "But it's the best competition in the world as far as I am concerned and we will give it our best shot." Brentford boss Martin Allen remained cautious despite his side's favourable draw - a home tie with either Hartlepool or Boston. "The best thing is, it's a home game. However, we know that whoever we play it is going to be a really tough game," said Allen. "But it's not about the opposition, it's about us. We all want to get through to the next round and face a massive team, that's the way it is."
 
 Meanwhile, the BBC has confirmed it will be televising Exeter's replay with Man Utd live on Wednesday 19 January, from 1930 on BBC One.
 
 Derby v Watford or Fulham
 
 Man Utd or Exeter v Middlesbrough
 
 Cardiff or Blackburn v Colchester
 
 Chelsea v Birmingham
 
 West Ham v Sheff Utd
 
 Oldham v Bolton
 
 Arsenal v Wolverhampton
 
 Everton v Sunderland
 
 Nottm Forest v Peterborough
 
 Brentford v Hartlepool or Boston
 
 Reading or Swansea v Leicester or Blackpool
 
 Burnley or Liverpool v Bournemouth
 
 Southampton v Portsmouth
 
 West Brom v Tottenham
 
 Newcastle v Coventry
 
 Charlton v Yeovil
llama3.2:1b:
Here is a concise summary of the text:

- Redknapp faces Pompey, Exeter City's home tie against Middlesbrough, and Oldham's home tie with Bolton.
- Pompey also face a replay against Manchester United if they beat Exeter in their fourth round FA Cup match.
- Other teams draw home ties: Chelsea vs Birmingham, Southampton vs Portsmouth, West Brom vs Tottenham, Charlton vs Yeovil.

qwen2.5:0.5b: Newport County face Exeter City in a replay against Portsmouth if they beat Manchester United, while Oldham host Bolton and Arsenal visit Wolverhampton. Chelsea play Hull, Tottenham face Liverpool, and Arsenal visit Burnley. The FA Cup tie involves Southampton, with Redknapp facing the club he walked away from six weeks ago. Exeter draw with Middlesbrough in a replay at Stamford Bridge. Brentford are home to either Hartlepool or Boston. Newcastle host Everton in their return trip. Stoke face Sunderland and Bolton in a replay for the Championship title. The BBC is covering a replay of Exeter's game against Manchester United, while Derby play Watford or Fulham. West Ham visits Sheff Utd. Aston Villa are away at Blackburn, and Reading are visiting Swansea. Burnley plays Liverpool vs Newcastle, with Southampton hosting Norwich. Everton face Sunderland in their return trip to the FA Cup final.

Birmingham hosts Chelsea despite being drawn as a tough competition. Brentford will play either Hartlepool or Boston. The BBC is televising Exeter's match with Manchester United live on Wednesday 19 January from 1930 on BBC One.

Chelsea host Birmingham, Tottenham visit West Brom, and Arsenal meet Wolves. The BBC confirms televising Exeter’s replay against Man Utd on January 19th. Other matches include Derby vs Watford/Watford or Fulham; Cardiff vs Blackburn or Colchester; and various home-and-away games.

However, despite being drawn against Portsmouth and holding a tie with either Manchester United or Charlton, Brentford manager Martin Allen remains cautious, stating that the best thing is a home game against either Hartlepool or Boston. Exeter City's opponents in their home match will be Manchester United or Portsmouth, who are all likely to be live on BBC One for the Wednesday 19 January episode. Derby, Watford, or Fulham will play each other for a possible live game, with Cardiff or Blackburn also appearing on the same day. Chelsea will travel to Birmingham in their first-ever FA Cup tie, while West Ham and Sheff Utd will face each other at Stamford Bridge. Oldham, Arsenal, and Everton are set for live matches on Wednesday 19 January, with Nottingham Forest, Peterborough, and Leicester vying to face off against Blackpool or Southend in a potential clash. Meanwhile, West Broom will host Tottenham on the same day, while Burnley or Liverpool will play against Bourne.
